page.title: 05Farming - Little Broadstone
page.content: I (Amy) live on a farm.We have pigs, chickens,cows,beef cattle and a goose. We have 80 sows,5 boars, and approx. 650 fattening pigs.The sows farrow 2 and half times a year and rear 22-23 piglets a year.The piglets are weaned from their mothers at three weeks and they are put into pens of 20-25 pigs. They are fed dry meal consisting of ground barley and protein concentrate. When they are 4 months old they weigh about 63 kg and are then sent for slaughter.As pork they produce a carcase of 50 Kg.The weaned sows are put with boars and should be served within a week;the gestation period is about 4 months.We have 2 house cows,served by a beef bull.They rear their own calves and a bought in calf. They give us milk for the house and baby pigs. We have 8 chickens which supply us with eggs.
